info.description:
Forecasting Setup allows you to access and configure Forecasting entities.

Forecasting allows you to provision and run forecasting operations, which provide the ability to view and modify volume forecasts and labor forecasts that the Scheduler uses to create schedules.

The Forecast Manager uses actual Point Of Sale (POS) and other business data from previous weeks and years to forecast business volume for a future date. This POS and business data is also known as volume driver data. The system forecasts volume at the daily level using the rules, business drivers, and special events that you set up.

From historical volume driver data, the Forecast Manager derives a traffic pattern. Then, applying your labor standards to volume driver data, as well as non-volume data, the Forecast Manager generates a labor forecast in 15-minute intervals, one week at a time.

From the labor forecast, the Scheduler looks at individual employees and schedule rules to create a 15-minute interval schedule, one week at a time, for each selected location.

The system uses the elements you configure to generate the volume forecast, the labor forecast, and the schedule.
info.title: Forecasting Setup

tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Foundations](doc:foundations-doc) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Adjustment Driver Settings. An Adjustment Driver is a metric that can be added to a Labor Constraint formula.
tags.name: Adjustment Driver Settings

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Budget Distribution Types, which represent a method according to which budget labor forecast is adjusted.
tags.name: Budget Distribution Types

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Category Property Sets by Category Assignments and date span. The Category Assignment is a reference from the corresponding Category Property Set to a Category.
tags.name: Category Property Set Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Category Property Sets. A Category Property Set is an object representing a set of properties used for a Category configuration.
tags.name: Category Property Sets

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Combined Labor Distributions. Combined Distribution allows you to combine labor standards for a task in order to even out labor distribution.
tags.name: Combined Labor Distributions

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Custom Driver Assignments by department category or by generic department.
tags.name: Custom Driver Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve the value of custom drivers, which are used to generate labor forecasts.
tags.name: Custom Drivers

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Forecast Planner Profiles. A Forecast Planner Profile allows an assignment of Forecast Planner Settings to a particular user.
tags.name: Forecast Planner Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Forecast Planner Settings.
tags.name: Forecast Planner Settings

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve a forecast week based on the name or ID of a category and a date that falls within the desired forecast week.
tags.name: Forecast Week

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve the default start day of a forecast week. The default start day is defined in the property site.forecasting.DefaultWeekStartDay.
tags.name: Forecast Week Start Days

Forecasting allows you to provision and run forecasting operations, which provide the ability to view and modify volume forecasts and labor forecasts that the Scheduler uses to create schedules.

The Forecast Manager uses actual Point Of Sale (POS) and other business data from previous weeks and years to forecast business volume for a future date. This POS and business data is also known as volume driver data. The system forecasts volume at the daily level using the rules, business drivers, and special events that you set up.

From historical volume driver data, the Forecast Manager derives a traffic pattern. Then, applying your labor standards to volume driver data, as well as non-volume data, the Forecast Manager generates a labor forecast in 15-minute intervals, one week at a time.

tags.name: Forecasting Setup

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve a list of all Generic Categories, or by name, ID, or object references.
tags.name: Generic Categories

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve Generic Departments.

Generic Departments simplify Forecasting configuration. You can create a configuration for a generic department (for example, 'Bakery') and these settings are applied to all departments with the same name.

A company may have hundreds of locations which share the same departments--for example, 'Shoes', 'Electronics', and so on. These departments often operate within the same general ranges, and labor standards, tasks, and tasks groups are applied to each.
tags.name: Generic Departments

tags.description:
This API resource is deprecated; instead, use Common Resources > Hours of Operation Assignments.

This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete hours of operation assignments in regular hours, each of which describes standard open and close times for each day of the week.
tags.name: Hours of Operation Assignments (Deprecated)

tags.description:
This API resource is deprecated; instead, use Common Resources > Hours of Operation Override Assignments.

This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete hours of operation override assignments, which describe changes to standard hours of operation for a specific date, such as a holiday.
tags.name: Hours of Operation Override Assignments (Deprecated)

tags.description:
This API resource is deprecated; instead, use Common Resources > Hours of Operation Overrides.

This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete hours of operation override objects, which describe changes to standard hours of operation for a specific date, such as a holiday.
tags.name: Hours of Operation Overrides (Deprecated)

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Labor Constraint Profiles. A Labor Constraint Profile allows an assignment of Labor Constraint Settings to a particular location.
tags.name: Labor Constraint Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Labor Constraint Settings.
tags.name: Labor Constraint Settings

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete labor distribution group profiles. Labor distribution group profiles allow labor distribution groups to be assigned to a site level or above.
tags.name: Labor Distribution Group Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete labor distribution groups. Labor distribution groups provide the ability to borrow hours from one job or department and apply those hours to another job or department.
tags.name: Labor Distribution Groups

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve labor forecast values. A labor forecast predicts the number of hours or people required per job to fulfill a projected amount of business.
tags.name: Labor Forecast

tags.description: This resource allows you to create and update labor forecast limits, which include minimum and maximum labor coverage requirements for jobs and job rounding factors.
tags.name: Labor Forecast Limits

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve labor standards, which define the relationship between volume and labor.
tags.name: Labor Standards

tags.description:
This resource allows you to import and purge labor standards, tasks, and task groups.

Labor standards contain time values for the amount of labor required to complete specific tasks, such as scanning an item. Labor standards are grouped into tasks. For example, the labor standards for callback, handle complaint, exterior event, and so on, can be grouped into the task of customer service. One or more tasks is assigned to a task group. Each job included in the labor forecast is associated with a task or task group. Only jobs that have a labor standard associated with them are included in the labor forecast.
tags.name: Labor Standards, Tasks, and Task Groups

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, update, retrieve and delete labor tasks.

Note that you must import or enter labor standards into the Forecast Manager before you can assign them to tasks. If you want to use Combined Distribution, you must create combined distribution items when you create tasks.
tags.name: Labor Tasks

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete linked categories, which allow you to track forecasted business volume for a site in two views without double-counting.
tags.name: Linked Categories

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Linked Category Action Types, which represent a method according to which volume driver data is adjusted for a linked category.
tags.name: Linked Category Action Types

tags.description: This resource allows you to manage specific Machine Learning configurations, which are also known as Machine Learning Models. Machine Learning is a self-tuning forecast method which is able to overcome limited history or sparsity, combine information from similar locations, and produce more accurate forecasts.
tags.name: Machine Learning Models

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve all period of application types, which indicate the way labor is distributed throughout the day.
tags.name: Period of Application Types

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and delete special event assignments. Special events fine-tune the volume forecast and are assigned to one or more categories in the business structure.
tags.name: Special Event Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to create and retrieve special events, which are variations of standard events.
tags.name: Special Events

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and delete static driver assignments.
tags.name: Static Driver Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Static Drivers. A Static Driver is a driver that cannot be forecasted but is based on a physical store attribute.
tags.name: Static Drivers

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Forecasting Task Groups.
tags.name: Task Groups

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Volume Drivers by Category Assignments. The Category Assignment is a reference from the corresponding Volume Driver to a Category.
tags.name: Volume Driver Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Volume Drivers. Volume Drivers are trackable expressions of business activity such as sales dollars, number of transactions processed, number of clients making purchases, and so on.
tags.name: Volume Drivers

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Volume Forecast Model Types, which represent a method according to which a forecast model is adjusted.
tags.name: Volume Forecast Model Types

post.description:
This operation deletes one or more labor distribution group profiles.

__Note:__ This operation supports a payload size of up to 1 MB.

The associated Access Control Point is as follows:

* __ACP Key:__ WFF_LABOR_DISTRIBUTION_GROUP_PROFILES

* __API Access Controlled By:__ Edit: Allowed

* __Default Value:__ Disallowed

* __Location in the UI:__ Retail Manager > Manager - Common Setup > Forecast Configuration > Labor Distribution Group Profiles

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of labor distribution group profiles that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Labor Distribution Group Profiles__ cannot exceed 5,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

post.description:
This operation creates (imports) labor forecasts and replaces the deprecated Import Labor Forecasts (POST /v1/forecasting/labor_forecast/import) API operation.

*__Note:__ This operation allows a request payload size of 5 megabytes, supports HTTP status code 207 Partial Success responses, and requires the number of jobs multiplied by the number of days to be less than 5000.*

The associated Access Control Point is WFF_LABOR_FORECAST.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of days multiplied by the number of jobs that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Days__ multiplied by the __Number of Jobs__ cannot exceed 5,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

## Best Practices

We recommend batching requests by passing jobs that belong to the same stores. Adjust the date range based on payload size and the service limit defined above.

For the best performance:

* import 1000 jobs per week or 166 jobs per month

*__Note:__ You will experience poor performance if you create multiple calls per store for the same timeframe, each call importing only part of the jobs for that store.*

post.description:
This operation returns labor forecast limits by search criteria. Only active limits with a single version effective on the provided date are retrieved when the search is performed by assigned jobs. Limits with any number of versions are retrieved when the search is performed by limit references, IDs, or qualifiers.

The associated Access Control Point is as follows:

* __ACP Key:__ WFF_LABOR_FORECAST_LIMITS

* __API Access Controlled By:__ Edit

* __Default Value:__ Disallowed

* __Location in the UI:__ Manager - Common Setup > Forecast Configuration > Labor Forecast Limits

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of jobs across all effective versions processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Jobs__ for all effective versions cannot exceed 10,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

post.description:
This operation is deprecated; instead use POST /v2/forecasting/labor_standard_tasks/import.

This operation imports multiple labor standards specific to a single store, generic department, and generic job, associates the imported labor standards with automatically-created store-specific Tasks, and associates the specified job and created Tasks with an automatically-created store-specific Task Group. The combination of the specified store, generic department, and generic job uniquely identify the actual job in the Business Structure.


Note: This operation allows a request payload size of 1 megabyte and does not support HTTP status code 207 Partial Success responses.


Best Practices


We recommend that each call defines a complete labor configuration per job.



Important Note: We recommend you update your implementations to utilize version 2 operations as they provide better security, performance, and functionality.

post.description:
This operation imports multiple labor standards specific to a single store, generic department, and generic job, associates the imported labor standards with automatically-created store-specific Tasks, and associates the specified job and created Tasks with an automatically-created store-specific Task Group. The combination of the specified store, generic department, and generic job uniquely identify the actual job in the Business Structure.


Note: This operation allows a request payload size of 1 megabyte and does not support HTTP status code 207 Partial Success responses.


The associated Access Control Points are as follows:

  • ACP Key: WFF_TASKS
  • API Access Controlled By: Edit
  • Default Value: Disallowed
  • Location in the UI: Manager - Common Setup > Forecast Configuration > Tasks and Task Groups > Tasks
  • ACP Key: WFF_LABOR_STANDARDS
  • API Access Controlled By: Edit
  • Default Value: Disallowed
  • Location in the UI: Manager - Common Setup > Forecast Configuration > Labor Standards
  • ACP Key: WFF_TASK_GROUPS

  • Default Value: Disallowed
  • Location in the UI: Manager - Common Setup > Forecast Configuration > Tasks and Task Groups
  • ACP Key: WFF_COMBINED_DISTRIBUTION
  • API Access Controlled By: Edit
  • Default Value: Disallowed
  • Location in the UI: Manager - Common Setup > Forecast Configuration > Combined Distribution

Note: All four ACPs must have the Edit option set to Allowed to allow access to this API operation.


Best Practices


We recommend that each call defines a complete labor configuration per job.

get.description:
This operation returns linked categories by category ID, category qualifier, and effective date. If no parameters are specified, this operation returns all linked categories.



Note: When no linked categories are found for specified category ID or qualifier and effective date, this operation defaults to returning an HTTP status code 400 error response. Set the error_if_not_found query parameter to false to instead return an HTTP status code 200 response with an empty array.
get.operationId: Retrieve All Linked Categories or by Specification

parameters.description: The ID of a category.
parameters.name: category_id

parameters.description: The qualifier of a category.
parameters.name: category_qualifier

parameters.description: The effective date of a category in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).

This operation creates one or more task groups.

The associated Access Control Point is WFF_TASK_GROUPS.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of jobs assigned to a single task group and the number of jobs that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Jobs Assigned to a Single Task Group__ cannot exceed 1,000.

* The __Number of Jobs__ specified in the request cannot exceed 5,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

post.description:
This operation updates one or more task groups.

The associated Access Control Point is WFF_TASK_GROUPS.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of jobs assigned to a single task group and the number of jobs that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Jobs Assigned to a Single Task Group__ cannot exceed 1,000.

* The __Number of Jobs__ specified in the request cannot exceed 5,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

LaborHourTotalAllocationRule.description: Model for labor hour allocation rule.

breakPlacementWindow.description: A window (in minutes) on each side of the day divide. Any gap in labor with a start day and end day that falls within this window and meets the maximum break duration is ignored. For example, if you define the window to be 60 minutes, then the window extends from one hour before the day divide to one hour after the day divide. The numerical value of this window represents minutes and can be 0 to 360. The value must be a multiple of 15 and greater than or equal to the maximum break duration.

laborHourAllocationRule.description: A type indicating how to allocate labor hours. The default value is ACTUAL_DAY. ACTUAL_DAY: Labor hours are split as they fall across the day divide. START_DAY: All hours for the job are applied to the day on which the labor hours begin. END_DAY: All hours for the job are applied to the day on which the labor hours end.

maximumBreakDuration.description: The number of minutes that defines a break in labor from 0 to 120. The number must be a multiple of 15.

skipBreaksInLabor.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not the Forecast Manager ignores breaks when it calculates labor hours for a given day when there are gaps of a specified duration in the labor requirements on either side of the day divide.

message.description: The message associated with a base error result.

dailyRoundingThreshold.description: The daily rounding threshold of a Curve Distribution.

SpecificBudgetDistribution.description: Model for a Specific Budget Distribution.

considerEventDaysAsHighTrafficDays.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not to consider event days as high traffic days.

numberOfHighTrafficDaysToAllowIncreases.description: The number of high traffic days to allow increases of a Specific Budget Distribution.

numberOfHighTrafficDaysToAvoidDecreases.description: The number of high traffic days to avoid decreases of a Specific Budget Distribution.

preventDecreasingOnHighTrafficDays.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not to prevent decreasing on high traffic days.

lag.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not to start labor distribution after the labor period. When false, labor distribution starts before the labor period. If no value is passed, labor distribution is the same as the selected labor period.

leadLagOffsetMinutes.description: The amount of time in minutes of distributing labor in relation to the defined labor period from 0 to 480. The number must be a multiple of 15.

type.description: The type indicating the way labor is distributed throughout the day. ABSOLUTE: labor period times are specific. HOO: labor periods are defined by the hours of operation for the department or site. HOO_CLOSE: start labor after the store closes. HOO_OPEN: start labor after the store opens.

forecastValue.description: The volume threshold in minutes, a positive value less than 9999999999.99999.

timeValue.description: The time value in minutes, a positive value less than 9999999999.99999.

LaborForecastLimitEffectiveVersionReques.description: Model describing the Labor Forecast Limit Effective Version request body.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the effective version in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).

TaskGroupEffectiveVersionRequestBody.description: Model describing the Task Group Effective Version request body for delete effective version operation.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the task group effective version in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).

TaskEffectiveVersionRequestBody.description: Model describing the Labor Task Effective Version request body.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the effective version in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).

BaseErrorDetailsForRest.description: Model context for base error details.

input.description: The input associated with base error details.

dayOfWeek.description: The day of the week. The default is EVERY_DAY.

endTime.description: The end time of a period element, from 00:00 to 23:45. The value must be a multiple of 15.

offsetDuration.description: The period duration in minutes, from 0 to 720. The value must be a multiple of 15.

offsetMinutes.description: The period offset in minutes, from -705 to 720. The value must be a multiple of 15.

startTime.description: The start time of a period element, from 00:00 to 23:45. The value must be a multiple of 15.
